obfuscation: ﻿ When Harriet and David meet they know that they 've found what they 've been looking for .
original: ﻿	When Harriet and David meet they know that they've found what they've been looking for.

obfuscation: Someone with whom they can make what they 've both been dreaming of and hoping and waiting for all their lives - a big happy family .
original: Someone with whom they can create what they've both been dreaming of and hoping and waiting for all their lives - a big happy family.

obfuscation: But when the fifth child comes along things variety and their happiness falls to pieces because Ben is not like them and he does n't fit into their lives .
original: But when the fifth child comes along things change and their happiness falls to pieces because Ben is not like them and he doesn't fit into their lives.

obfuscation: They say he 's unlike .
original: They say he's different.

obfuscation: But is he actually different ?
original: But is he really different?

obfuscation: And if thus , then what is he different from ?
original: And if so, then what is he different from?

obfuscation: The independent theme of this text is the meeting of two worlds , the normal and the abnormal , the known and the unknown , the civilized and the foreign .
original: The main theme of this text is the meeting of two worlds, the normal and the abnormal, the known and the unknown, the civilized and the foreign.

obfuscation: These worlds are represented by the family on one side and Ben on the early .
original: These worlds are represented by the family on one side and Ben on the other.

obfuscation: By studying the setting of this text we can see how these worlds relate to eachother and to their surroundings .
original: By studying the setting of this text we can see how these worlds relate to eachother and to their surroundings.

obfuscation: David and Harriet are unlike .
original: David and Harriet are different.

obfuscation: That is stated from the very inaugural page in this text .
original: That is stated from the very first page in this text.

obfuscation: They are two oddballs who find in each early exactly what they have been looking for to spend their future with .
original: They are two oddballs who find in each other exactly what they have been looking for to spend their future with.

obfuscation: They share the like dreams and beliefs .
original: They share the same dreams and beliefs.

obfuscation: Their definitions of happiness are the like .
original: Their definitions of happiness are the same.

obfuscation: But it must be sorted out - what makes differet mean in this case ?
original: But it must be sorted out - what does differet mean in this case?

obfuscation: A contradictive sentence to what I 've precisely stated in the first page is `` They defended a stubbornly held view of themselves which was that they were ordinary ... '' ( p.7 ) .
original: A contradictive sentence to what I've just stated in the first page is "They defended a stubbornly held view of themselves which was that they were ordinary..."(p.7).

obfuscation: Ordinary .
original: Ordinary.

obfuscation: Is n't that the direct opposite of unlike ?
original: Isn't that the direct opposite of different?

obfuscation: We must make clean that different in this case means not like most people in their surroundings while ordinary means old-fashioned .
original: We must make clear that different in this case means not like most people in their surroundings while ordinary means old-fashioned.

obfuscation: Then comes the fifth child and slowly tears the family aside with his violence , hate and cold , evil eyes .
original: Then comes the fifth child and slowly tears the family apart with his violence, hate and cold, evil eyes.

obfuscation: He is unlike too .
original: He is different too.

obfuscation: But from what ?
original: But from what?

obfuscation: There are several things in the text that show that the world outside this class bliss is changing : `` [ ... ] the greedy and selfish sixties [ ... ] '' .
original: There are several things in the text that show that the world outside this family bliss is changing: "[...]the greedy and selfish sixties[...]".

obfuscation: ( p.29 ) `` The small town [ ... ] had changed [ ... ] .
original: (p.29) "The little town[...]had changed[...].

obfuscation: Brutal incidents and crimes , once shocking everyone , were nowadays commonplace . ''
original: Brutal incidents and crimes, once shocking everyone, were now commonplace."

obfuscation: ( p.29 ) `` Two peoples existed in England , not one - enemies , hating eachother , who would not hear what the other said . ''
original: (p.29) "Two peoples lived in England, not one - enemies, hating eachother, who would not hear what the other said."

obfuscation: ( p.30 ) Ben is greedy and selfish .
original: (p.30) Ben is greedy and selfish.

obfuscation: Whenever he speaks it is to say things like `` Give me this '' or `` Ben wants that '' .
original: Whenever he speaks it is to say things like "Give me this" or "Ben wants that".

obfuscation: And he is selfish because the only reason he is controllable to a certain point is Harriets threat to bring him back to the place that scares him .
original: And he is selfish because the only reason he is controllable to a certain point is Harriets threat to take him back to the place that scares him.

obfuscation: Later on Ben leads to crime and violence , robbery , rape etc .
original: Later on Ben takes to crime and violence, robbery, rape etc.

obfuscation: Without defending it in any way I have to say that it is n't uncommon , it makes n't take an alien to do it .
original: Without defending it in any way I have to say that it isn't uncommon, it doesn't take an alien to do it.

obfuscation: The two peoples that populated England can well be represented by Paul , the youngest child who is the one who gets largely effected by Ben 's presence , and Ben .
original: The two peoples that populated England can well be represented by Paul, the youngest child who is the one who gets mostly effected by Ben's presence, and Ben.

obfuscation: They hated eachother .
original: They hated eachother.

obfuscation: thus if Ben is part of this world , what he really is different from is Harriet 's and David 's family life .
original: So if Ben is part of this world, what he really is different from is Harriet's and David's family life.

obfuscation: possibly that 's why everyone outside the family fails to recognize what Harriet so badly needs confirmed - that Ben is different .
original: Maybe that's why everyone outside the family fails to recognize what Harriet so badly needs confirmed - that Ben is different.

obfuscation: He makes n't fit in to their odd life but maybe he is just a contemporary figure that ends up in an anachronism .
original: He doesn't fit in to their odd life but maybe he is just a contemporary figure that ends up in an anachronism.

obfuscation: Their is another exaple of how David and Harriet are unlike from other people on page 8 .
original: Their is another exaple of how David and Harriet are different from other people on page 8.

obfuscation: David and Harriet are watching people at the dance enjoying themselves .
original: David and Harriet are watching people at the dance enjoying themselves.

obfuscation: '' Both had reflected that the faces of the dancers [ ... ] could precisely as well have been distorted in screams and grimaces of pain as in enjoyment '' .
original: "Both had reflected that the faces of the dancers [...] could just as well have been distorted in screams and grimaces of pain as in enjoyment".

obfuscation: They see the world in a different direction .
original: They see the world in a different way.

obfuscation: They do not fit in .
original: They do not fit in.

obfuscation: And they get a child that maybe does fit in to the rest of the world , but not in their lives .
original: And they get a child that maybe does fit in to the rest of the world, but not in their lives.

obfuscation: Harriet and David are unlike from each other too in some ways and that is also important for how they react to Ben and deal with him .
original: Harriet and David are different from each other too in some ways and that is also important for how they react to Ben and deal with him.

obfuscation: They have for example unlike backgrounds .
original: They have for example different backgrounds.

obfuscation: His parents are divorced while her mother seems to have everything she wants .
original: His parents are divorced while her mother seems to have everything she wants.

obfuscation: possibly that explains why David does n't leave , although he thinks his wife has let him down .
original: Maybe that explains why David doesn't leave, although he thinks his wife has let him down.

obfuscation: And Harriet blames herself for Harriet calls Ben an alien and spends hours trying to figure away where he comes from , who are the ones of his own kind .
original: And Harriet blames herself for Harriet calls Ben an alien and spends hours trying to figure out where he comes from, who are the ones of his own kind.

obfuscation: She tries to these two worlds to go in concert but David does n't .
original: She tries to these two worlds to go together but David doesn't.

obfuscation: They cope with this matter in different ways .
original: They deal with this matter in different ways.

obfuscation: Harriet wants to determine what is going on inside Ben 's head , how he sees the world , what he thinks about .
original: Harriet wants to learn what is going on inside Ben's head, how he sees the world, what he thinks about.

obfuscation: She also tries to make Ben more like them .
original: She also tries to make Ben more like them.

obfuscation: She wants to teach him by making him watch her and Paul play and then play the like game with him .
original: She wants to teach him by making him watch her and Paul play and then play the same game with him.

obfuscation: David precisely wants to get rid of him .
original: David just wants to get rid of him.

obfuscation: He accepts the idea that Ben will never be like them .
original: He accepts the thought that Ben will never be like them.

obfuscation: On page 13 it says `` his wife must be like him in this ; that she knew where happiness lay and how to prevent it '' .
original: On page 13 it says "his wife must be like him in this; that she knew where happiness lay and how to keep it".

obfuscation: When Harriet failed him in this matter by going back for Ben she made him very angry and disappointed .
original: When Harriet failed him in this matter by going back for Ben she made him very angry and disappointed.

obfuscation: But rather of leaving her he burried himself in work which kept him from home all day .
original: But instead of leaving her he burried himself in work which kept him from home all day.

obfuscation: Why ?
original: Why?

obfuscation: Maybe because he knew that the damage was already made the moment Ben came in to their lives .
original: Maybe because he knew that the damage was already done the moment Ben came in to their lives.

obfuscation: Leaving him to die in that place would n't have their happiness .
original: Leaving him to die in that place wouldn't have their happiness.
